Title: The Impact of the Coronavirus Lockdown on Mental Health: Evidence from the US
has research problem: Effect of the COVID-19 pandemic on well-being
operationalisation of dependent variable: WHO 5-question module

Title: Alleinlebende verkraften die Pandemie erstaunlich gut
has research problem: Effect of the COVID-19 pandemic on well-being
operationalisation of dependent variable: 11-point Likert scale ranging from 0 (not satisfied at all) to 10 (very satisfied)

Title: Psychische Krise durch Covid-19? Sorgen sinken, Einsamkeit steigt, Lebenszufriedenheit bleibt stabil
has research problem: Effect of the COVID-19 pandemic on well-being
operationalisation of dependent variable: 11-point Likert scale ranging from 0 (not satisfied at all) to 10 (very satisfied)

Title: The gender gap in mental well-being during the Covid-19 outbreak: evidence from the UK
has research problem: Effect of the COVID-19 pandemic on well-being
operationalisation of dependent variable: Likert index that sums 12 questions from the General Health Questionnaire (GHQ-12)

Title: Parental well-being in times of Covid-19 in Germany
has research problem: Effect of the COVID-19 pandemic on well-being
population: All persons aged 18 or older who are eligible to vote in Germany
operationalisation of dependent variable: 11-point Likert scale ranging from 0 (not satisfied at all) to 10 (very satisfied)
control variables: Occupation, Employment status, Gender, Education, Household income, Household size, State, Age

Title: Who is most affected by the Corona crisis? An analysis of changes in stress and well-being in Switzerland
has research problem: Effect of the COVID-19 pandemic on well-being
operationalisation of dependent variable: 11-point Likert scale ranging from 0 ‘not at all satisfied’ to 10 ‘completely satisfied

Title: Up and About: Older Adults’ Well-being During the COVID-19 Pandemic in a Swedish Longitudinal Study
has research problem: Effect of the COVID-19 pandemic on well-being
has data: HEalth, Aging and Retirement Transitions in Sweden (HEARTS)
operationalisation of dependent variable: Life Satisfaction measured by 5 items, range 1-7

Title: Employee psychological well-being during the COVID-19 pandemic in Germany: A longitudinal study of demands, resources, and exhaustion
has research problem: Effect of the COVID-19 pandemic on well-being
operationalisation of dependent variable: Copenhagen Burnout Inventory’s (CBI, Kristensen et al., 2005) subscale Personal Burnout
identification method: random-intercept and slope model (linear and quadratic effect of time on exhaustion)
effect size - explanation: significant quadratic effect of study week on exhaustion, b= -2.17

Title: The COVID-19 pandemic and subjective well-being: longitudinal evidence on satisfaction with work and family
has research problem: Effect of the COVID-19 pandemic on well-being
operationalisation of dependent variable: 11-point scale from 0 to 10 with 0 being ‘completely dissatisfied’ and 10 being ‘completely satisfied’

Title: Socioeconomic status and well-being during COVID-19: A resource-based examination.
has research problem: Effect of the COVID-19 pandemic on well-being
operationalisation of dependent variable: 10-point scale from 1 to 10 with 1 being ‘very dissatisfied’ and 10 being ‘very satisfied'

Title: Individual differences and changes in subjective wellbeing during the early stages of the COVID-19 pandemic.
has research problem: Effect of the COVID-19 pandemic on well-being
operationalisation of dependent variable: 7-point scale ranging from 1-very dissatisfied to 7-very satisfied
identification method: Unconditional multivariate discontinuous latent growth curve model
